acceptance_commands: python -c "from lsysviz.expand import expand; from lsysviz.types import Grammar; g = Grammar(axiom='A', rules={'A': 'AB', 'B': 'A'}); assert expand(g, 0) == 'A'; assert expand(g, 1) == 'AB'; assert expand(g, 2) == 'ABA'; assert expand(g, 3) == 'ABAAB'"
forbidden: Do not modify any other existing files
intent: Create lsysviz/expand.py with a pure function that expands an L-system grammar string for a given number of iterations.
notes: Define: expand(grammar: Grammar, iterations: int) -> str. When iterations is 0, return grammar.axiom unchanged. For each iteration, replace every character in the current string: if the character is a key in grammar.rules, substitute the corresponding value; otherwise keep the character as-is. The function must be pure and deterministic. Do NOT modify lsysviz/types.py — it is provided for reference only.
title: Implement L-system string expansion
